get.summary:
Fetch all api-keys in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- read:api_keys

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

TODO: ListOptions

delete.summary:
Deletes an api-key in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- delete:api_keys

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: apiKeyId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the api-key (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

get.summary:
Fetch all management keys in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- read:management_keys

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

delete.summary:
Deletes a management key in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- delete:management_keys

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: managementKeyId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the management key (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Creates an api-key in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:api_keys

parameters.name: apiKey.accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Creates a management key in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:management_keys

parameters.name: managementKey.accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the api-key (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after an api-key is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the api-key was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after an api-key is created.

clusterIds.description:
A list of cluster IDs
Should contain at least a single ID.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

prefix.description:
Prefix for the API key, this represents the first bytes of the token
This is a read-only field and will be available after an api-key is created.

token.description:
The token for the API key.
This is a read-only field and will be available only once in the return of CreateApiKey.
You should securely store this token and it should be handled as a secret.

AuthServiceCreateApiKeyBody.title: CreateApiKeyRequest is the request for the CreateApiKey function

id.description:
Unique identifier for the management key (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a management key is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the management key was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a management key is created.

prefix.description:
Prefix for the management key, this represents the first bytes of the key.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a management key is created.

key.description:
The value of the key, to be used to authenticate requests to the Qdrant Cloud API.
This is a read-only field and will be available only once in the response of CreateManagementKey.
You should securely store this key and it should be handled as a secret.

AuthServiceCreateManagementKeyBody.title: CreateManagementKeyRequest is the request for the CreateManagementKey function

id.description:
Unique identifier for the api-key (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after an api-key is created.

accountId.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the api-key was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after an api-key is created.

clusterIds.description:
A list of cluster IDs
Should contain at least a single ID.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

prefix.description:
Prefix for the API key, this represents the first bytes of the token
This is a read-only field and will be available after an api-key is created.

token.description:
The token for the API key.
This is a read-only field and will be available only once in the return of CreateApiKey.
You should securely store this token and it should be handled as a secret.

authv2ApiKey.title:
A ApiKey represents one api-key of a Qdrant cloud account.
This api-key can grant access to one or more Qdrant databases (clusters)

v2CreateApiKeyResponse.title: CreateApiKeyResponse is the response from the CreateApiKey function

v2CreateManagementKeyResponse.title: CreateManagementKeyResponse is the response from the CreateManagementKey function

v2DeleteApiKeyResponse.title: DeleteApiKeyResponse is the response from the DeleteApiKey function

v2DeleteManagementKeyResponse.title: DeleteManagementKeyResponse is the response from the DeleteManagementKey function

items.description: TODO: Add an operation timestamp the ListApiKeys is started, to support the `since` in ListOptions
items.title: The actual api-keys in this list

v2ListApiKeysResponse.title: ListApiKeysResponse is the response from the ListApiKeys function

items.description: The actual management keys in this list.

v2ListManagementKeysResponse.title: ListManagementKeysResponse is the response from the ListManagementKeys function

id.description:
Unique identifier for the management key (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a management key is created.

accountId.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the management key was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a management key is created.

prefix.description:
Prefix for the management key, this represents the first bytes of the key.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a management key is created.

key.description:
The value of the key, to be used to authenticate requests to the Qdrant Cloud API.
This is a read-only field and will be available only once in the response of CreateManagementKey.
You should securely store this key and it should be handled as a secret.

v2ManagementKey.description:
A ManagementKey represents a management key of a Qdrant Cloud account.
This management key grants access to the Qdrant Cloud API.
